traceability.evidence: • src/cli-options.js: parseFormatFlag supports validFormats including 'json' and exits with code 2 on invalid value • bin/dry-aged-deps.js: recognizes --format=json, skips npm call when package.json present, outputs JSON via printOutdated and handles errors with JSON error objects and correct exit codes • src/print-outdated.js & handlers: on format==='json', routes through handleJsonOutput → prepareJsonItems → jsonFormatter, producing valid parseable JSON with timestamp, packages array, summary section, thresholds, and no extra console noise • test/cli.format-json.test.js, test/printOutdated.json.test.js, test/json-formatter.test.js verify valid JSON structure, complete data fields, summary and thresholds, and silent stderr • test/cli.format-json.error.test.js verifies JSON error output and exit 2 on npm failure • test/cli.check-mode.test.js covers exit codes 0/1 in JSON mode • test/cli-entrypoint.test.js verifies --help includes --format option • Default table output unchanged (test/cli.outdated.test.js checks default behavior)
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for JSON output format have tests verifying: CLI flag support, JSON validity, complete data (packages info, vulnerabilities, age), summary section, exit codes (0/1/2), suppressed console noise, error handling as JSON, default table mode, and help documentation. Implementation code and unit/integration tests confirm full compliance.
